alert.note: Alert for Prentiss (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following county, Prentiss. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 PM CDT, runoff from earlier heavy rainfall continued to pose a threat for minor urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen across central Prentiss County. - Booneville is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Booneville, Jumpertown, Wheeler, Thrashers, Gaston, Blackland and Frankstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
